alert.note: Alert for Clark; Taylor (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 19 at 3:05AM CST until January 19 at 6:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Snow Through Mid-Morning... .Snow will continue to advance northward this morning with most of the accumulating snow along and north of Interstate 90. There will be some periods of heavy snow...mainly north of Interstate 94. By mid-morning, the main area of snow should move out of the area leaving behind some light snow for much of the area into the afternoon. In the heaviest snow, hourly rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour will be possible, which will quickly cause travel conditions to become hazardous. With the additional accumulations this morning, storm total amounts are still expected to be in the 4 to 8 inch range for much of the area. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches. * WHERE...Taylor and Clark Counties. * WHEN...Until 6 PM CST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
